name: The Fool
mainMeaning: New beginnings, innocence, spontaneity, free spirit
description: The Fool represents new beginnings, trust in the future, lack of experience, uncertainty about what lies ahead, beginnerâ€™s luck, improvisation, and faith in the universe.

name: The Magician
description: The Magician symbolizes the ability to use one's talents, creativity, and resources to achieve goals. It is a card of initiative, confidence, and action.

name: The High Priestess
mainMeaning: Intuition, divine knowledge, divine femininity, subconscious mind
reverseMeaning: Secrets, disconnection from intuition, withdrawal, silence
description: The High Priestess represents wisdom, peace, knowledge, and understanding. She is the guardian of the subconscious, showing the way to spiritual self-awareness.

name: The Empress
description: The Empress is a symbol of fertility, beauty, and abundance. She represents growth, nurturing, and connection with nature.

name: The Emperor
reverseMeaning: Domination, excessive control, lack of discipline, inflexibility
description: The Emperor represents authority, establishment, and structure that provides stability and security. He is the father figure, embodying the concepts of law and order.

name: The Hierophant
mainMeaning: Spiritual wisdom, religious beliefs, conformity, tradition, institutions
reverseMeaning: Personal beliefs, freedom, challenging the status quo
description: The Hierophant symbolizes spiritual wisdom, traditional values, and institutions. He represents the connection between the spiritual and earthly realms.

name: The Lovers
description: The Lovers represent love, harmony, relationships, and choices. This card signifies deep connection and cooperation between two individuals.

name: The Chariot
reverseMeaning: Lack of control, lack of direction, failure
description: The Chariot signifies determination, action, and direction. It represents personal control and power to achieve goals.

name: Strength
description: Strength symbolizes inner strength, courage, and patience. This card represents the ability to overcome obstacles with compassion and kindness.

name: The Hermit
description: The Hermit signifies self-reflection, inner wisdom, and solitude. This card represents withdrawing into oneself to seek guidance and truth.

name: Wheel of Fortune
description: Wheel of Fortune symbolizes change, luck, and destiny. This card represents the cycles of life and new opportunities.

name: Justice
description: Justice represents justice, truth, and balance. This card stands for fair judgment and decisions based on truth.

name: The Hanged Man
mainMeaning: Sacrifice, new perspective, acceptance, letting go
description: The Hanged Man signifies sacrifice, new perspectives, and acceptance. This card represents letting go and embracing change.

name: Death
description: Death symbolizes endings, transformation, and change. This card represents rebirth and new opportunities after an ending.

name: Temperance
description: Temperance represents balance, moderation, and patience. This card symbolizes harmony and the ability to adjust in order to achieve equilibrium.

name: The Devil
description: The Devil represents obsession, restriction, and temptation. This card symbolizes attachment to material things and control.

name: The Tower
description: The Tower represents sudden change, collapse, and crisis. This card symbolizes liberation from unsustainable situations.

name: The Star
reverseMeaning: Loss of hope, lack of confidence, disappointment
description: The Star represents hope, inspiration, and peace. This card symbolizes faith and spiritual guidance.

name: The Moon
description: The Moon represents illusion, intuition, and uncertainty. This card symbolizes the subconscious and things that are not yet clear.

name: The Sun
description: The Sun represents success, happiness, and positivity. This card symbolizes energy and the brightness of life.

name: Judgement
description: Judgement represents judgement, rebirth, and awakening. This card symbolizes decision-making and new awareness.

name: The World
description: The World represents completion, achievement, and fulfillment. This card symbolizes the journey and the end of a cycle.

name: Ace of Wands
description: Ace of Wands represents inspiration, potential, and creativity. This card symbolizes new opportunities and beginnings.

name: Two of Wands
reverseMeaning: Fear of change, lack of planning, limitation
description: Two of Wands represents planning, exploration, and decisiveness. This card symbolizes expansion and progress.

name: Three of Wands
description: Three of Wands represents expectation, expansion, and exploration. This card symbolizes opportunity and progress in plans.

name: Four of Wands
description: Four of Wands represents celebration, unity, and happiness. This card symbolizes achievement and completion.

name: Five of Wands
description: Five of Wands represents conflict, challenge, and competition. This card symbolizes disagreements and difficulties in reaching goals.

name: Six of Wands
description: Six of Wands represents victory, success, and recognition. This card symbolizes pride and achieving goals.

name: Seven of Wands
description: Seven of Wands represents defense, struggle, and perseverance. This card symbolizes overcoming challenges and defending one's stance.

name: Eight of Wands
description: Eight of Wands represents movement, speed, and progress. This card symbolizes quick progress and communication.

name: Nine of Wands
description: Nine of Wands represents resilience, defense, and patience. This card symbolizes determination and protecting one's goals.

name: Ten of Wands
description: The Ten of Wands represents burden, responsibility, and pressure. This card symbolizes stress and the weight of life.

name: Page of Wands
reverseMeaning: Lack of creativity, procrastination, lack of motivation
description: The Page of Wands represents exploration, creativity, and energy. This card signifies inspiration and new beginnings.

name: Knight of Wands
description: The Knight of Wands symbolizes passion, enthusiasm, and action. This card represents adventure and a strong desire.

name: Queen of Wands
description: The Queen of Wands represents confidence, independence, and decisiveness. This card symbolizes charm and the power of femininity.

name: King of Wands
description: The King of Wands symbolizes leadership, vision, and decisiveness. This card represents inspiration and guidance.

name: Ace of Cups
description: The Ace of Cups symbolizes love, emotions, and new beginnings. This card represents overflowing feelings and deep connections.

name: Two of Cups
description: The Two of Cups represents partnership, love, and relationships. This card symbolizes harmony and connection between two people.

name: Three of Cups
description: The Three of Cups symbolizes celebration, friendship, and support. This card represents joy and community connections.

name: Four of Cups
description: The Four of Cups symbolizes contemplation, apathy, and missed opportunities. This card represents dissatisfaction and feelings of stagnation.

name: Five of Cups
description: The Five of Cups represents loss, grief, and disappointment. This card symbolizes regret and feelings of loss.

name: Six of Cups
reverseMeaning: The past hinders, difficulty moving on, dependence
description: The Six of Cups symbolizes nostalgia, the past, and innocence. This card represents memories and connections to the past.

name: Seven of Cups
description: The Seven of Cups represents illusion, choices, and imagination. This card symbolizes opportunities and creative thinking.

name: Eight of Cups
description: The Eight of Cups symbolizes abandonment, seeking, and change. This card represents moving away and searching for new experiences.

name: Nine of Cups
mainMeaning: Satisfaction, joy, dreams come true, achievement
description: The Nine of Cups symbolizes satisfaction, joy, and dreams coming true. This card represents achievement and a sense of happiness.

name: Ten of Cups
reverseMeaning: Loss of harmony, family rift, unhappiness
description: The Ten of Cups signifies family happiness, fulfillment, and love. This card represents harmony and a sense of happiness within the family.

name: Page of Cups
reverseMeaning: Lack of inspiration, impracticality, blocked emotions
description: The Page of Cups symbolizes inspiration, innocence, and emotion. This card represents creativity and new beginnings in feelings.

name: Knight of Cups
description: The Knight of Cups represents romance, idealism, and charm. This card symbolizes emotions and the search for love.

name: Queen of Cups
description: The Queen of Cups embodies emotion, intuition, and sensitivity. This card represents nurturing and compassion.

name: King of Cups
reverseMeaning: Lack of balance, pressure, emotional control issues
description: The King of Cups signifies emotional control, balance, and wisdom. This card represents compassion and emotional management.

name: Ace of Swords
description: The Ace of Swords symbolizes truth, intellect, and clarity. This card represents decisions and insight.

name: Two of Swords
description: The Two of Swords represents stalemate, choice, and opposition. This card symbolizes uncertainty and difficulty in making decisions.

name: Three of Swords
description: The Three of Swords signifies heartbreak, hurt, and betrayal. This card represents sadness and feelings of loss.

name: Four of Swords
description: The Four of Swords symbolizes rest, recovery, and reflection. This card represents pause and tranquility.

name: Five of Swords
description: The Five of Swords signifies conflict, defeat, and tension. This card represents disappointment and difficulties in relationships.

name: Six of Swords
description: The Six of Swords symbolizes transition, movement, and new hope. This card represents change and moving forward.

name: Seven of Swords
description: The Seven of Swords signifies deception, strategy, and secrecy. This card represents fraud and dishonesty.

name: Eight of Swords
description: The Eight of Swords symbolizes feeling stuck, restriction, and feeling trapped. This card represents difficulties and limitations in life.

name: Nine of Swords
reverseMeaning: Relief from anxiety, finding hope, overcoming fear
description: The Nine of Swords signifies anxiety, stress, and nightmares. This card represents fear and feelings of unease.

name: Ten of Swords
description: The Ten of Swords symbolizes endings, hurt, and betrayal. This card represents pain and feelings of loss.

name: Page of Swords
description: The Page of Swords signifies curiosity, intelligence, and exploration. This card represents decisiveness and a spirit of inquiry.

name: Knight of Swords
description: The Knight of Swords represents decisiveness, energy, and determination. This card symbolizes action and determination.

name: Queen of Swords
description: The Queen of Swords represents intellect, independence, and clarity. This card symbolizes clear thinking and analytical abilities.

name: King of Swords
description: The King of Swords represents wisdom, leadership, and analysis. This card symbolizes justice and leadership abilities.

name: Ace of Pentacles
description: The Ace of Pentacles represents new beginnings, opportunities, and potential. This card symbolizes prosperity and financial opportunities.

name: Two of Pentacles
description: The Two of Pentacles represents balance, flexibility, and management. This card symbolizes multitasking and managerial skills.

name: Three of Pentacles
reverseMeaning: Lack of cooperation, poor work quality, lack of recognition
description: The Three of Pentacles represents collaboration, teamwork, and skill. This card symbolizes recognition and success in work.

name: Four of Pentacles
reverseMeaning: Lack of control, overprotection, excessive spending
description: The Four of Pentacles represents control, protection, and stability. This card symbolizes accumulation and the safeguarding of assets.

name: Five of Pentacles
description: The Five of Pentacles represents difficulty, loss, and poverty. This card symbolizes failure and a sense of lack.

name: Six of Pentacles
description: The Six of Pentacles represents generosity, help, and balance. This card symbolizes sharing and financial equilibrium.

name: Seven of Pentacles
description: The Seven of Pentacles represents patience, evaluation, and waiting. This card symbolizes investment and perseverance at work.

name: Eight of Pentacles
reverseMeaning: Laziness, lack of effort, poor-quality work
description: The Eight of Pentacles represents hard work, learning, and skill. This card symbolizes refinement and effort in work.

name: Nine of Pentacles
reverseMeaning: Lack of independence, dependency, financial loss
description: The Nine of Pentacles represents independence, prosperity, and pride. This card symbolizes success and pride in one's achievements.

name: Ten of Pentacles
description: The Ten of Pentacles represents family prosperity, stability, and legacy. This card symbolizes achievement and family stability.

name: Page of Pentacles
reverseMeaning: Lack of learning, missed opportunity, lack of curiosity
description: The Page of Pentacles represents learning, opportunity, and potential. This card symbolizes curiosity and exploration.

name: Knight of Pentacles
description: The Knight of Pentacles represents steadfastness, hard work, and stability. This card symbolizes reliability and stability in work.

name: Queen of Pentacles
description: The Queen of Pentacles represents nurturing, prosperity, and stability. This card symbolizes compassion and care in family matters.

name: King of Pentacles
reverseMeaning: Lack of prosperity, abuse of power, unreliability
description: The King of Pentacles represents prosperity, leadership, and financial security. This card symbolizes reliability and leadership abilities.
